channel.title: Servers and private servers
channel.description: Ok this is going to make me sound stuiped but what is the differences between them.

item.title: Servers and private servers
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

BobDole81:

In regard to Moparscape and Runescape, a private server is a server emulator - its not the real RS server, but one that was made to copy, or emulate, the functions of the real RS server. Private just indicates that it is not one of the “public” servers run by jagex.

I thought it was named “private” because you could play it locally on a LAN, even without internet. Oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: Servers and private servers
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

A private server, in the most general term, is a server. A server by definition is an application or computer that is able to accept clients and perform various tasks for them.

In regard to Moparscape and Runescape, a private server is a server emulator - its not the real RS server, but one that was made to copy, or emulate, the functions of the real RS server. Private just indicates that it is not one of the “public” servers run by jagex.

Read full topic

They’re just different names of what people call them…

And so on.
